meanings.definition: To cut or fell with a chainsaw.
meanings.sent1: He chainsawed the tree down in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The lumberjack chainsawed through the thick log effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The chainsawed tree looked like a giant puzzle on the ground.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the chainsawed wood echoed through the woods.
meanings.sent5: The chainsawed branches scattered across the yard like pick-up sticks.

meanings.sent1: The chainsawed was left in the shed after the job was done.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the chainsawed buzzing in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The chainsawed reminded me of the hard work we put in last summer.
meanings.sent4: The smell of the chainsawed lingered in the air.
meanings.sent5: The chainsawed sat quietly in the corner, waiting for its next use.
